title: Phishing Attacks
description: Phishing happens when attackers send fake emails or links that look real to steal your personal information.
prevention: Always check the sender’s email address and do not click unknown links. Report suspicious messages immediately.

title: Weak Passwords
description: Using simple or repeated passwords makes it easy for hackers to guess and break into your account.
prevention: Use strong passwords with letters, numbers, and special symbols. Change them regularly.

title: Social Engineering
description: Attackers manipulate people into revealing confidential data by pretending to be trusted individuals.
prevention: Verify the person’s identity before sharing any information or credentials.

title: Negligence
description: Leaving devices unlocked or ignoring security warnings can lead to unauthorized access.
prevention: Always lock your devices and follow security guidelines strictly.

title: Data Mishandling
description: Accidentally sending sensitive data to the wrong person or storing it insecurely.
prevention: Double-check recipients and use encrypted channels for sharing confidential data.
